00001 """
00002 This module contains a class for managing efficiency/performance
00003 experiments.
00004 """
00005 
00006 
00007 class EfficiencyTable:
00008     """
00009     Manage the CPU times of efficiency experiments and make
00010     tabular reports with sorted results.
00011 
00012     >>> e = EfficiencyTable('some description of the experiments')
00013     >>> e.add('about an experiment', cpu_time)
00014     >>> e.add('about another experiment', cpu_time)
00015     >>> e.add('about a third experiment', cpu_time)
00016     >>> print e  # prints a sorted table with scaled CPU times
00017     >>> e += e2  # add experiments from EfficiencyTable e2 to e
00018     """
00019     def __init__(self, description, normalization_time=None):
00020         """
00021         description: a string acting as headline for this test.
00022         normalization_time: all CPU times will be divided by this value
00023         (if not set, the class will find the smallest (best) CPU
00024         time and divide all others by this value. The best_time
00025         parameter can also be set in the set_normalization_time method.)
00026         """
00027         self.descriptiondescription = description
00028         self.experimentsexperiments = {}  # key=description, value=[CPU-time1, CPU-time2, ]
00029         self._normalization_time_normalization_time = normalization_time
00030 
00031     def add(self, description, CPU_time, function_name=None):
00032         """
00033         Add the CPU time of an experiment, together with a description
00034         and an optional function_name (which is appended to the
00035         description string).
00036         """
00037         if function_name is not None:
00038             # include name of the tested function as part of the description:
00039             description = description + ' (%s)' % function_name
00040         if not description in self.experimentsexperiments:
00041             self.experimentsexperiments[description] = []
00042         self.experimentsexperiments[description].append(CPU_time)
00043 
00044     def __iadd__(self, other):
00045         """
00046         Add results in other to present results.
00047         New items (descriptions) are simply registered, while
00048         identical items (descriptions) will have a list of CPU times,
00049         corresponding to the different EfficiencyTable instances.
00050         """
00051         self.descriptiondescription += '\n' + other.description
00052         for e in other.experiments:
00053             if e in self.experimentsexperiments:
00054                 # this experiment is already registered, add the lists of CPU times:
00055                 self.experimentsexperiments[e].extend(other.experiments[e])
00056             else:
00057                 self.experimentsexperiments[e] = other.experiments[e]
00058         return self
00059             
00060     def __add__(self, other):
00061         """As e += table (see __iadd__)."""
00062         e = EfficiencyTable(self.descriptiondescription)
00063         e.experiments = self.experimentsexperiments.copy()
00064         e.__iadd__(other)
00065         return e
00066 
00067     def set_normalization_time(self, t):
00068         """Set the CPU time by which all other CPU times will be divided."""
00069         self._normalization_time_normalization_time = t
00070         
00071     def _reference_CPU_time(self, experiment_idx=0):
00072         if self._normalization_time_normalization_time is not None:
00073             for description in self.experimentsexperiments:
00074                 if abs(self.experimentsexperiments[description][experiment_idx] - \
00075                        self._normalization_time_normalization_time) < 1.0E-10:
00076                     return self._normalization_time_normalization_time, description
00077                 
00078         # find best performance:
00079         # (only search among positive CPU times for an experiment wit
00080         # index experiment_idx)
00081         best = 1.0E+20
00082         cpu_eps = 1.0E-4  # smallest reliable CPU time
00083         for description in self.experimentsexperiments:
00084             cpu_time = self.experimentsexperiments[description][experiment_idx]
00085             # drop counting very small (unreliable) or negative
00086             # (erroneous timings) CPU times:
00087             if cpu_time > cpu_eps:
00088                 if cpu_time < best:
00089                     best = cpu_time
00090                     best_key = description
00091 
00092         if best == 1.0E+20:
00093             # did not find any CPU time > cpu_eps
00094             raise ValueError, 'too small CPU times (all less than %E)' % cpu_eps
00095         return best, best_key
00096     
00097     def __str__(self):
00098         """
00099         Print out a sorted list (with respect to CPU times) of the experiments.
00100         In case of multiple CPU times per description of an experiment,
00101         the table is sorted with respect to the first CPU time entry of each
00102         multiple CPU times list.
00103         """
00104         # inv_dict is the inverse dictionary of self.experiments, i.e.,
00105         # CPU time is the key and the description is the valid.
00106         # Only the first CPU time entry is used.
00107         
00108         # inv_dict computation does not work if the CPU times are very
00109         # small (0.00 is the key of many), so we need to add a small
00110         # random number to very small CPU times
00111         import random, math
00112         inv_dict = {}  # inverse of self.experiments
00113         for k in self.experimentsexperiments:
00114             CPU_time = self.experimentsexperiments[k][0]
00115             if math.fabs(CPU_time) < 1.0E-7:
00116                 CPU_time += 1.0E-14*random.random()
00117             if CPU_time in inv_dict:
00118                 # this destroys the one-to-one mapping, perturb CPU_time:
00119                 CPU_time *= 1.0 + 1.0E-3*random.random()
00120             self.experimentsexperiments[k][0] = CPU_time
00121             inv_dict[CPU_time] = k
00122         # sort CPU-times:
00123         cpu_times0 = inv_dict.keys()
00124         cpu_times0.sort()
00125         s = '\n\n' + '*'*80 + '\n' + self.descriptiondescription + '\n' + '*'*80 + '\n'
00126         self.best, self.best_keybest_key = self._reference_CPU_time_reference_CPU_time(0)
00127         s += 'reference CPU time based on the experiment\n   "%s"\nwith '\
00128              'CPU time:\n  %s\n\n' % \
00129              (self.best_keybest_key, str(self.experimentsexperiments[self.best_keybest_key])[1:-1])
00130 
00131         max_length = max([len(string) for string in self.experimentsexperiments.keys()])
00132         for cpu_time_key in cpu_times0:
00133             description = inv_dict[cpu_time_key]
00134             s += '%%-%ds | ' % max_length % description
00135             for cpu_time, ref_time in \
00136                     zip(self.experimentsexperiments[description],
00137                         self.experimentsexperiments[self.best_keybest_key]):
00138                 nc = cpu_time/ref_time
00139                 if abs(nc) > 9999.0:
00140                     s += '%10.1e' % nc
00141                 else:
00142                     s += '%8.2f' % nc
00143             s += '\n'
00144         return s
00145 
00146 def plot(filename):
00147     f = open(filename, 'r')
00148     lines = f.readlines()
00149     f.close()
00150     for i in range(len(lines)):
00151         if lines[i].find('CPU times') >= 0:
00152             start = i+3
00153             break
00154     counter = 1
00155     curves = {}
00156     labels = open('tmp_plot_labels', 'w')
00157     import math
00158     for line in lines[start:]:
00159         name, numbers = line.split('|')
00160         curves[name] = [float(x) for x in numbers.split()]
00161         for i in range(len(curves[name])):
00162             try:
00163                 curves[name][i] = math.log10(curves[name][i])
00164             except ValueError:
00165                 curves[name][i] = 0.0
00166         f = open('tmp_plot_%02d' % counter, 'w')
00167         for i in range(len(curves[name])):
00168             v = curves[name][i]
00169             if v > 0.0:
00170                 f.write('%2d  %g\n' % (i+1, v))
00171         f.close()
00172         counter += 1
00173         labels.write('%2d: %s\n' % (counter, name))
00174     labels.close()
00175     # generate Gnuplot script:
00176     plotfiles = ['"tmp_plot_%02d" title "%d" with lines' % (i,i) \
00177                  for i in range(1,len(lines[start:])+1)]
00178     cmd = 'plot ' + ', '.join(plotfiles)
00179     f = open('tmp_plot.gnuplot', 'w')
00180     f.write("""
00181 set xrange [0:%d]
00182 %s
00183 """ % (len(curves[name])+1, cmd))
00184     f.close()
00185                    
00186

00188 def _test(n):
00189     # how much does it cost to run an empty loop with
00190     # range, xrange and iseq?
00191     e = EfficiencyTable('Empty loops, loop length = %d' % n)
00192     t1 = timeit.Timer('for i in range(n): pass',
00193                       setup='n=%d' % n).timeit(5)
00194     e.add('for i in range(n): pass', t1)
00195     t2 = timeit.Timer('for i in xrange(n): pass',
00196                       setup='n=%d' % n).timeit(5)
00197     e.add('for i in xrange(n): pass', t2)
00198     t3 = timeit.Timer('for i in iseq(stop=n-1): pass',
00199                       setup='from graphics.numpytools import iseq;' +
00200                       'n=%d' % n).timeit(5)
00201     e.add('for i in iseq(stop=n-1): pass', t3)
00202     print e
00203     
00204 if __name__ == '__main__':
00205     _test()
